primary.context: Customer wanted to make a payment on their account.
primary.detail: The AI could not verify the customer's name against the account, leading to a transfer request.

steps: Customer requested to pay maintenance fees.
Agent attempted to verify the account by name multiple times without success.
Agent successfully looked up the account via contract ID but still failed to match the name.
Customer became frustrated and requested a human representative.
Agent transferred the call to the concierge department.

failure.detail: Agent failed to match the customer's name to the account even after the customer spelled it correctly and provided a valid contract ID.

clarifications.note: Name did not match initial lookup
Second attempt to verify name failed

loops.subject: Name verification
loops.note: Repeatedly asking for name despite spelling

actions.detail: Name verification failed after contract lookup
Transferred to concierge per user request

insights.summary: The customer wanted to pay maintenance fees but was blocked by a persistent name verification failure. Despite providing a contract ID and spelling her name, the AI could not validate the account, resulting in a transfer to a human.
insights.verbatim: Talk to representative. Talk Take me to take me to representative. I don't wanna talk to you.
insights.coaching: The agent should have a lower threshold for transferring when a customer has already spelled their name and provided a contract ID without success, rather than asking for the name a fourth time.
